content: garment that needs to wrap or tie setup you must be on the right side rs of your work step 1 purlwise insertion insert the right needle purlwise into the first stitch on the left needle step 2 yarn over wrap the yarn around the right needle as if to knit step 3 knit bring the needle back through the stitch creating a new loop on the right needle keep this new loop loose step 4 slip back slip the new loop on the right needle back onto the left needle as if to purl step 5 bind off insert the right needle purlwise into the first two stitches on the left needle and bind off repeat repeat the step 2 to 5 treating the stitches worked in the step 5 as a single unit to knit through pattern begins tip of bandana cast on co 3 stitches turn your work setup row ws slip 1 purlwise with yarn in front sl p1 wyif purl 2 preparing body the shaping is created by increasing every other row on all right side/rs row the first stitch of every row is slipped purlwise for rs and ws row to create a neat edge selvedge row 1 rs sl 1 wyib k2 eor row 2 ws sl 1 wyif p2 eor row 3 rs increase sl 1 wyib m1r k1 m1l k1 eor row 4 ws sl 1 wyif p to eor row 5 rs increase sl 1 wyib k1 m1r k1 m1l k2 eor row 6 ws sl 1 wyif p to eor row 7 rs increase sl 1 wyib k1 m1r k until 2 st before end m1l k2 eor row 8 ws sl 1 wyif p to eor shaping main body now that the initial tip is formed you will repeat with increase until you reach desired length row 1 rs increase sl 1 wyib k1 m1r k until 2 st before end m1l k2 eor row 2 ws sl 1 wyif p to eor repeat row 1 and row 2 until the bandana reaches your preferred neck circumference or size sizing note for a 43 cm neck circumference the sample was knitted until it reached 79 stitches across the final row this is about 48cm length finishing bind off with a stretchy bind off recommended bind off icelandic bind off gives a flexible and decorative finish which is easier to tie around the neck however standard stretchy bind off also works well if you
